title: Multi-Label Learning: Strategies for Solving Complex Data Classification Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic statistics, machine learning concepts, and experience with Python programming
context.additional_context: A course aiming to cultivate skills in developing multi-label classification models for workplace social data analysis. Provides mobile-accessible microlearning content in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Designing a classification model capable of processing two or more new labels simultaneously in dynamic data stream environments.
Performing anomaly detection and clustering using OPTICS clustering.
Applying optimization techniques for linear classification models to minimize classification errors.
Establishing a phased update strategy to maintain model performance when integrating new labels.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
